me.utk.networking

Interface NetworkAddress


  • public interface NetworkAddress
    An IP address/port pair which represents a connection address to a server.

    This interface is designed to complement ServerImplementations, and it is not based upon any standard address definitions or conventions.

    Version:
    December 8, 2020
    Author:
    Utkarsh Priyam
    See Also:
    ServerImplementation

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      InetAddress getAddress()
      Returns the IP address of this NetworkAddress.
      int getPort()
      Returns the port of this NetworkAddress.

    • Method Detail

      • getAddress

        InetAddress getAddress()
        Returns the IP address of this NetworkAddress.

        Note that ServerSocket.getInetAddress() does not necessarily return a useful address, typically returning 0.0.0.0 or the IPv6 equivalent instead. This API recommends but does not require using the result of InetAddress.getLocalHost() or another similar method.

        Returns:
        A usable form of the IP address of this NetworkAddress
        See Also:
        InetAddress.getLocalHost(), ServerSocket.getInetAddress()

      • getPort

        int getPort()
        Returns the port of this NetworkAddress.

        This value is guaranteed to return a value between 0 and 65535, inclusive. Any implementation which does not satisfy this requirement should note that in its documentation.

        Returns:
        The connected socket of this NetworkAddress
